messages.title: Focus on Potholes
messages.content: Now the winter weather is over, potholes cause accidents and damage vehicles. Your local Lib Dems have been busy reporting and monitoring the repairs.

messages.title: BIG SWAP reaches Wimbledon
messages.content: As part of Fairtrade fortnight, the local Lib Dem Fairtrade group asked residents to switch their shopping to Fairtrade products where possible.

messages.title: Let's not be rubbish at recycling
messages.content: PROTECTING OUR ENVIRONMENT is a key priority for the Dundonald Lib Dem Focus Team. Government figures show that, in the latest period available, Merton recycled 28% of its waste.

messages.title: Air quality challenge to “Eco Park” Waste processing plant
messages.content: In 2008/9, the Dundonald Lib Dem Team campaigned strongly against the extra heavy traffic noise on the area because Dundonald Park lies in an area of poor air quality.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Lib Dem-controlled Kingston and Richmond Councils did much better at recycling than Merton Council. Efforts to improve Dundonald Park air quality against waste processing plant expansion.

mentions.candidate: Anthony Fairclough successfully lobbied for recycling bins at our stations. Anthony does not just appear during election time - he constantly hassled the council, would it have happened otherwise?
mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: A leaflet from local Conservative councillors previously said: 'There are enough recycling plants in the borough to manage Merton’s waste.' They refused to confirm what this meant.
mentions.tacticalSituation: Here in Dundonald, it's a straight fight between Liberal Democrats and the Tories. Labour and the Greens can't win here and we never hear from them except at elections.

issues.environment: Protecting the environment is a key priority. The Dundonald Lib Dem Focus Team has been working on recycling and tackling air quality issues.

images.caption: Anthony Fairclough and Lib Dem team working on environmental initiatives.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet details efforts regarding recycling within the constituency, the local Lib Dem team's campaign against the expansion of a waste processing plant, and emphasizes the tactical voting situation in Dundonald where it's a competition between the Liberal Democrats and the Tories.
